trans-unit.source: How to use Table storage from Python | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Table storage from Python | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how you can use the Table service from Python to create and delete a table, and to insert and query a table.
trans-unit.target: Learn how you can use the Table service from Python to create and delete a table, and to insert and query a table.

trans-unit.source: How to use Table storage from Python
trans-unit.target: How to use Table storage from Python

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios by using the Azure Table storage service.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios by using the Azure Table storage service.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in Python and use the [Python Azure Storage package][].
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in Python and use the [Python Azure Storage package][].

trans-unit.source: The covered scenarios include creating and deleting a
trans-unit.target: The covered scenarios include creating and deleting a

trans-unit.source: table, in addition to inserting and querying entities in a table.
trans-unit.target: table, in addition to inserting and querying entities in a table.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you need to install Python or the [Python Azure package][], see the [Python installation guide](../python-how-to-install.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you need to install Python or the [Python Azure package][], see the [Python installation guide](../python-how-to-install.md).

trans-unit.source: Create a table
trans-unit.target: Create a table

trans-unit.source: The **TableService** object lets you work with table services.
trans-unit.target: The **TableService** object lets you work with table services.

trans-unit.source: The
trans-unit.target: The

trans-unit.source: following code creates a **TableService** object.
trans-unit.target: following code creates a **TableService** object.

trans-unit.source: Add the code near
trans-unit.target: Add the code near

trans-unit.source: the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:
trans-unit.target: the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a **TableService** object by using the storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a **TableService** object by using the storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.
trans-unit.target: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.

trans-unit.source: Add an entity to a table
trans-unit.target: Add an entity to a table

trans-unit.source: To add an entity, first create a dictionary that defines your entity
trans-unit.target: To add an entity, first create a dictionary that defines your entity

trans-unit.source: property names and values.
trans-unit.target: property names and values.

trans-unit.source: Note that for every entity, you must
trans-unit.target: Note that for every entity, you must

trans-unit.source: specify **PartitionKey** and **RowKey**.
trans-unit.target: specify **PartitionKey** and **RowKey**.

trans-unit.source: These are the unique
trans-unit.target: These are the unique

trans-unit.source: identifiers of your entities.
trans-unit.target: identifiers of your entities.

trans-unit.source: You can query these values much
trans-unit.target: You can query these values much

trans-unit.source: faster than you can query your other properties.
trans-unit.target: faster than you can query your other properties.

trans-unit.source: The system uses **PartitionKey** to
trans-unit.target: The system uses **PartitionKey** to

trans-unit.source: automatically distribute the table entities over many storage nodes.
trans-unit.target: automatically distribute the table entities over many storage nodes.

trans-unit.source: Entities that have the same **PartitionKey** are stored on the same node.
trans-unit.target: Entities that have the same **PartitionKey** are stored on the same node.

trans-unit.source: **RowKey** is the unique ID of the entity within the partition that it
trans-unit.target: **RowKey** is the unique ID of the entity within the partition that it

trans-unit.source: belongs to.
trans-unit.target: belongs to.

trans-unit.source: To add an entity to your table, pass a dictionary object
trans-unit.target: To add an entity to your table, pass a dictionary object

trans-unit.source: to the **insert\_entity** method.
trans-unit.target: to the **insert\_entity** method.

trans-unit.source: You can also pass an instance of the **Entity** class to the **insert\_entity** method.
trans-unit.target: You can also pass an instance of the **Entity** class to the **insert\_entity** method.

trans-unit.source: Update an entity
trans-unit.target: Update an entity

trans-unit.source: This code shows how to replace the old version of an existing entity
trans-unit.target: This code shows how to replace the old version of an existing entity

trans-unit.source: with an updated version.
trans-unit.target: with an updated version.

trans-unit.source: If the entity that is being updated does not exist, then the update
trans-unit.target: If the entity that is being updated does not exist, then the update

trans-unit.source: operation will fail.
trans-unit.target: operation will fail.

trans-unit.source: If you want to store an entity
trans-unit.target: If you want to store an entity

trans-unit.source: regardless of whether it existed before, use **insert\_or\_replace_entity**.
trans-unit.target: regardless of whether it existed before, use **insert\_or\_replace_entity**.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the first call will replace the existing entity.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the first call will replace the existing entity.

trans-unit.source: The second call will insert a new entity, since no entity with the specified **PartitionKey** and **RowKey** exists in the table.
trans-unit.target: The second call will insert a new entity, since no entity with the specified **PartitionKey** and **RowKey** exists in the table.

trans-unit.source: Change a group of entities
trans-unit.target: Change a group of entities

trans-unit.source: Sometimes it makes sense to submit multiple operations together in a
trans-unit.target: Sometimes it makes sense to submit multiple operations together in a

trans-unit.source: batch to ensure atomic processing by the server.
trans-unit.target: batch to ensure atomic processing by the server.

trans-unit.source: To accomplish that, you
trans-unit.target: To accomplish that, you

trans-unit.source: use the **begin\_batch** method on **TableService** and then call the
trans-unit.target: use the **begin\_batch** method on **TableService** and then call the

trans-unit.source: series of operations as usual.
trans-unit.target: series of operations as usual.

trans-unit.source: When you do want to submit the
trans-unit.target: When you do want to submit the

trans-unit.source: batch, you call **commit\_batch**.
trans-unit.target: batch, you call **commit\_batch**.

trans-unit.source: Note that all entities must be in the same partition in order to be changed as a batch.
trans-unit.target: Note that all entities must be in the same partition in order to be changed as a batch.

trans-unit.source: The example below adds two entities together in a batch.
trans-unit.target: The example below adds two entities together in a batch.

trans-unit.source: Query for an entity
trans-unit.target: Query for an entity

trans-unit.source: To query an entity in a table, use the **get\_entity** method by
trans-unit.target: To query an entity in a table, use the **get\_entity** method by

trans-unit.source: passing **PartitionKey** and **RowKey**.
trans-unit.target: passing **PartitionKey** and **RowKey**.

trans-unit.source: Query a set of entities
trans-unit.target: Query a set of entities

trans-unit.source: This example finds all tasks in Seattle based on **PartitionKey**.
trans-unit.target: This example finds all tasks in Seattle based on **PartitionKey**.

trans-unit.source: Query a subset of entity properties
trans-unit.target: Query a subset of entity properties

trans-unit.source: A query to a table can retrieve just a few properties from an entity.
trans-unit.target: A query to a table can retrieve just a few properties from an entity.

trans-unit.source: This technique, called *projection*, reduces bandwidth and can improve
trans-unit.target: This technique, called *projection*, reduces bandwidth and can improve

trans-unit.source: query performance, especially for large entities.
trans-unit.target: query performance, especially for large entities.

trans-unit.source: Use the **select**
trans-unit.target: Use the **select**

trans-unit.source: parameter and pass the names of the properties that you want to bring over
trans-unit.target: parameter and pass the names of the properties that you want to bring over

trans-unit.source: to the client.
trans-unit.target: to the client.

trans-unit.source: The query in the following code returns only the descriptions of
trans-unit.target: The query in the following code returns only the descriptions of

trans-unit.source: entities in the table.
trans-unit.target: entities in the table.

trans-unit.target: This is not supported by the storage
